뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).english:
아버지 = father (standard, everyday — how you refer to your own dad)
아버님 = father (honorific address — respectfully referring to someone else's father, or formal occasions)
부친 = father (Sino-Korean, written/formal — obituaries, official documents, biographical records)
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example: 아버지, 다녀왔습니다. / 아버님, 건강하세요. / 부친상을 당해 장례를 치렀다.
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example_en: Dad, I'm home. / Father, please stay healthy. (honorific) / He held a funeral after his father's passing.

뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).english:
자식 = one's child/kids (casual, sometimes pejorative — 'my kids', or as insult: '이 자식아')
자녀 = children/offspring (formal, neutral — documents, news, policy discussions)
자제분 = son/daughter (honorific — respectfully referring to someone else's children)
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example: 자식이 셋이다. / 자녀 교육에 관심이 많다. / 자제분이 참 훌륭하시네요.
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example_en: I have three kids. / Very interested in children's education. / Your son/daughter is truly outstanding.

뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).english:
편지 = letter (everyday, personal — handwritten or casual correspondence)
서신 = correspondence/letter (formal — literary, official personal letters)
서한 = letter/epistle (most formal — diplomatic communications, open letters, government)
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example: 친구에게 편지를 썼다. / 두 사람 사이의 서신이 발견되었다. / 대통령에게 공개 서한을 보냈다.
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example_en: I wrote a letter to a friend. / Correspondence between the two was discovered. / Sent an open letter to the president.

뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).english:
그렇지만 = but / nevertheless (softer, conversational — acknowledging before countering)
그러나 = however (formal/written — crisp literary contrast)
하지만 = but (most common spoken connector — straightforward everyday opposition)
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example: 그렇지만 포기할 수는 없다. / 그러나 현실은 녹록지 않다. / 하지만 난 괜찮아.
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example_en: But I can't give up. / However, reality is not easy. / But I'm fine.

뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).english:
그리고 = and / and then (spoken, standard — linking sentences or listing items casually)
및 = and / as well as (formal/written — official lists, legal and academic documents)
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example: 커피 그리고 케이크를 주문했다. / 지원서 및 관련 서류를 제출하세요.
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example_en: I ordered coffee and cake. / Please submit the application and related documents.

뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).english:
왜 = why (basic, everyday — casual and direct)
어째서 = why / how come (slightly more emphatic or frustrated — spoken, pressing for a reason)
어찌하여 = for what reason (literary/archaic — formal writing, historical texts)
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example: 왜 안 왔어? / 어째서 아무 말도 안 하는 거야? / 어찌하여 이 지경에 이르렀는가.
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example_en: Why didn't you come? / How come you're not saying anything? / For what reason has it come to this state?

뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).english:
요즘 = these days / lately (casual, spoken — personal current life)
최근 = recently (neutral/formal — news, reports, precise time reference)
근래 = of late / in recent times (literary/formal — broader timeframe, slightly archaic tone)
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example: 요즘 바빠? / 최근 연구에 따르면 효과가 있다. / 근래에 보기 드문 폭설이었다.
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example_en: Are you busy these days? / According to recent research, it's effective. / It was a heavy snowfall rarely seen of late.

뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).english:
지금 = now (spoken, immediate — everyday temporal marker)
현재 = currently / at present (formal — reports, official status descriptions, broadcasts)
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example: 지금 뭐 해? / 현재 조사가 진행 중입니다.
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example_en: What are you doing now? / An investigation is currently in progress.

뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).english:
옛날 = the old days / long ago (narrative, warm — fairy tales, personal nostalgia)
과거 = the past (neutral/formal — history, looking back analytically)
이전 = before / prior (relative time reference — 'before this point', not necessarily distant)
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example: 옛날에 호랑이가 살았다. / 과거의 실수를 반복하지 말자. / 이전에는 여기가 공원이었다.
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example_en: Long ago, a tiger lived here. / Let's not repeat past mistakes. / Before, this used to be a park.

뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).english:
거의 = almost / nearly (degree-focused — approaching but not reaching a threshold)
대부분 = most / the majority (quantity-focused — the greater portion of a set)
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example: 거의 다 왔다. / 대부분의 학생이 찬성했다.
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example_en: We're almost there. / Most of the students agreed.

뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).english:
점점 = gradually / more and more (common, spoken — noticeable incremental change)
차차 = little by little (softer, patient — things improving slowly over time)
점차 = gradually (formal/written — statistical or analytical gradual change)
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example: 날씨가 점점 추워진다. / 차차 나아질 거야. / 점차 경기가 회복되고 있다.
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example_en: The weather is getting colder and colder. / It'll get better little by little. / The economy is gradually recovering.

뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).english:
어떻게 = how (standard, everyday — asking about method or expressing disbelief)
어찌 = how / how could (literary/rhetorical — formal writing, dramatic emphasis, often rhetorical questions)
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example: 어떻게 하면 될까? / 어찌 이런 일이 있을 수 있는가.
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example_en: How should I do it? / How could such a thing be possible?

뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).english:
돌보다 = to look after / take care of (general — children, elderly, pets, household matters)
보살피다 = to tend to / care for with devotion (warm, nurturing — more emotional investment)
간호하다 = to nurse (medical care — tending to the sick or injured specifically)
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example: 아이를 돌보다. / 아픈 어머니를 정성껏 보살피다. / 환자를 밤새 간호했다.
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example_en: To look after a child. / To tenderly care for a sick mother. / Nursed the patient through the night.

뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).english:
다투다 = to quarrel / argue (verbal disagreement — bickering, disputes between people)
싸우다 = to fight (broader — verbal or physical, can be serious or playful)
분쟁하다 = to be in conflict / dispute (formal — legal, territorial, organizational conflicts)
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example: 형제끼리 다투지 마. / 학교에서 싸웠다. / 양국이 영토 문제로 분쟁하고 있다.
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example_en: Don't quarrel with your siblings. / Got into a fight at school. / The two countries are in a territorial dispute.

뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).english:
알맞다 = just right / fitting (native Korean, casual — size, temperature, amount being right)
적합하다 = suitable / qualified (Sino-Korean — meeting requirements, matching criteria)
적절하다 = appropriate / proper (Sino-Korean — fitting for the context, well-timed action)
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example: 양이 딱 알맞다. / 이 자리에 적합한 인물이다. / 적절한 조치를 취했다.
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example_en: The amount is just right. / He's the right person for this position. / Took appropriate measures.

뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).english:
시작하다 = to start / begin (general — everyday, any context)
착수하다 = to commence / set about (formal — initiating serious work, projects, investigations)
개시하다 = to commence / open (official — military operations, formal proceedings, systems going live)
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example: 수업을 시작합시다. / 수사에 착수했다. / 투표를 개시합니다.
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example_en: Let's start the class. / They commenced the investigation. / Voting will now commence.

뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).english:
끝나다 = to end / be over (general, casual — events, tasks reaching their natural end)
종료하다 = to terminate / conclude (formal — programs, systems, contracts officially ending)
마감하다 = to close / wrap up by deadline (specific — submissions, applications, editing deadlines)
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example: 회의가 끝났다. / 프로그램이 종료되었습니다. / 접수가 내일 마감됩니다.
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example_en: The meeting ended. / The program has been terminated. / Registration closes tomorrow.

뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).english:
다르다 = to be different (native Korean, everyday — general difference between things)
상이하다 = to differ / be disparate (Sino-Korean, formal — academic, legal, emphasizing notable differences)
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example: 생각이 다르다. / 두 보고서의 내용이 상이하다.
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example_en: Our thoughts are different. / The contents of the two reports differ.

뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).english:
같다 = to be the same / like (native Korean, everyday — similarity or equivalence)
동일하다 = to be identical (Sino-Korean, formal — exact sameness, legal/technical)
일치하다 = to match / coincide (Sino-Korean — agreement, alignment of data, opinions, or facts)
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example: 우리 생각이 같다. / 동일한 제품입니다. / 지문이 일치했다.
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example_en: Our thoughts are the same. / It's an identical product. / The fingerprints matched.

뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).english:
나타나다 = to appear / show up (general — someone arriving, symptoms appearing, results emerging)
출현하다 = to emerge / come into existence (formal — new species, phenomena, historical figures appearing)
등장하다 = to make an entrance / appear on scene (characters in stories, new products, people entering a context)
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example: 갑자기 경찰이 나타났다. / 새로운 바이러스가 출현했다. / 소설에 새로운 인물이 등장한다.
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example_en: The police suddenly appeared. / A new virus has emerged. / A new character appears in the novel.

뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).english:
자라다 = to grow up (native Korean, personal — children, plants growing naturally)
성장하다 = to grow / develop (Sino-Korean, formal — economic growth, personal development, companies expanding)
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example: 시골에서 자랐다. / 경제가 빠르게 성장하고 있다.
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example_en: I grew up in the countryside. / The economy is growing rapidly.

뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).english:
보내다 = to send (native Korean, general — messages, packages, people, everyday)
발송하다 = to dispatch / send out (formal — mass mailings, official shipments)
송부하다 = to transmit / forward (very formal — legal, official document transmission)
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example: 친구에게 사진을 보냈다. / 안내문을 발송했습니다. / 관련 서류를 송부해 주시기 바랍니다.
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example_en: Sent a photo to a friend. / The notice has been dispatched. / Please forward the relevant documents.

뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).english:
나누다 = to divide / share (native Korean, general — splitting things, sharing food, having a conversation)
분배하다 = to distribute (Sino-Korean — distributing resources, wealth, profits among recipients)
배분하다 = to allocate / apportion (Sino-Korean, systematic — budget allocation, task assignment by proportion)
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example: 케이크를 나눠 먹자. / 이익을 공정하게 분배하다. / 예산을 부서별로 배분했다.
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example_en: Let's share the cake. / Distribute profits fairly. / Allocated the budget by department.

뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).english:
함께 = together (native Korean, warm — doing something side by side, companionship)
공동으로 = jointly / in partnership (formal — shared ownership, collaboration between parties)
합동으로 = in a joint operation / combined (formal — organizations, military, large-scale coordinated effort)
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example: 함께 가자. / 공동으로 연구를 진행했다. / 경찰과 군이 합동으로 수사를 실시했다.
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example_en: Let's go together. / Conducted research jointly. / Police and military carried out a joint investigation.

뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).english:
돌아보다 = to look back on / reflect (native Korean — casual or personal reflection on the past)
회고하다 = to reminisce / retrospect (Sino-Korean, formal — structured reflection, memoirs, official reviews)
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example: 지나온 시간을 돌아보다. / 은퇴 후 자신의 경력을 회고했다.
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example_en: Looking back on the time that has passed. / After retiring, he reflected on his career.

뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).english:
무안하다 = embarrassed / humiliated (feeling embarrassed by being put on the spot or rejected — loss of face)
쑥스럽다 = bashful / sheepish (self-conscious, shy embarrassment — from praise, attention, or self-awareness)
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example: 거절당해서 무안했다. / 칭찬을 받으니 쑥스럽다.
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example_en: I was embarrassed by the rejection. / I feel bashful receiving praise.

뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).english:
못마땅하다 = displeasing / disapproving (internal judgment — something doesn't sit right, often shown through expression)
불만스럽다 = dissatisfied / discontented (more explicit displeasure — actively unhappy with a situation or outcome)
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example: 아들의 선택이 못마땅하다. / 처우가 불만스러워 항의했다.
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example_en: I disapprove of my son's choice. / Protested due to dissatisfaction with the treatment.

뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).english:
허탈하다 = deflated / let down (empty feeling when something ends anticlimactically — 'all that for nothing')
낙담하다 = discouraged / disheartened (losing confidence or hope after setback — formal)
실망하다 = disappointed (general, most common — unmet expectations)
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example: 시합이 취소되어 허탈했다. / 연이은 실패에 낙담하지 마라. / 결과에 실망했다.
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example_en: Felt deflated when the match was canceled. / Don't be discouraged by repeated failures. / I was disappointed with the result.

뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).english:
서글프다 = wistfully sad / melancholic (a quiet, lingering sadness about life or circumstances — reflective)
구슬프다 = plaintive / mournful (the kind of sadness that moves you to tears — evoked by music, stories, voices)
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example: 홀로 나이 드는 것이 서글프다. / 구슬픈 노랫소리가 들려왔다.
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example_en: Growing old alone feels wistfully sad. / A plaintive singing voice could be heard.

뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).english:
흐뭇하다 = warmly pleased / contentedly happy (quiet inner satisfaction — watching something turn out well)
대견하다 = admirable / impressive (pride and approval toward someone younger — 'you've done well, I'm proud')
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example: 아이들이 잘 노는 모습을 보니 흐뭇하다. / 혼자 힘으로 해내다니 대견하다.
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example_en: Watching the kids play nicely makes me warmly pleased. / Doing it on your own — how admirable.

뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).english:
참담하다 = devastating / appalling (emotionally crushing situation — formal, about outcomes or realities)
처참하다 = gruesome / horrific (visually or physically terrible — wreckage, aftermath, brutal conditions)
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example: 참담한 성적표를 받았다. / 사고 현장이 처참했다.
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example_en: Received a devastating report card. / The accident scene was horrific.

뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).english:
그윽하다 = deep and serene / profound in atmosphere (literary — a gaze, fragrance, or forest with quiet depth)
은은하다 = subtle / softly lingering (delicate sensory presence — faint light, quiet fragrance, soft music)
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example: 그윽한 눈빛으로 바라보았다. / 은은한 향이 퍼졌다.
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example_en: Gazed with deep, serene eyes. / A subtle fragrance wafted through.

뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).english:
~마저 = even (the last remaining thing gone too — cumulative loss, 'even X is gone')
~조차 = even (not even the minimum — emphasizing shocking inadequacy)
~까지 = even / up to (addition or extent — surprise that X is also included, or reaching a limit)
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example: 희망마저 사라졌다. / 이름조차 기억 못 한다. / 친한 친구까지 등을 돌렸다.
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example_en: Even hope has vanished. / Can't even remember the name. / Even close friends turned their backs.

뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).english:
~만 = only / just (standard restriction — neutral, versatile)
~뿐 = only / nothing but (more emphatic, formal — stressing exclusivity)
~밖에 = nothing but / only (always with negative verb — emphasizing insufficiency)
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example: 나만 알고 있어. / 믿을 건 너뿐이다. / 천 원밖에 없다.
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example_en: Only I know. / You're the only one I can trust. / I only have 1,000 won.

뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).english:
오직 = only / solely (exclusive devotion or singularity — emphatic, 'one and only')
단지 = merely / just (downplaying significance — 'it's just that')
다만 = however / only (adding a caveat or qualification — 'the one thing is...')
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example: 오직 너만을 사랑한다. / 단지 궁금해서 물어본 거야. / 좋은 계획이다. 다만 시간이 부족하다.
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example_en: I love only you. / I just asked out of curiosity. / It's a good plan. However, time is short.

뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).english:
그래도 = still / even so (casual, everyday — persisting despite obstacles)
그럼에도 = nevertheless / despite that (formal written — conceding a point then countering)
그렇더라도 = even if that's the case (hypothetical concession — even supposing it's true)
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example: 힘들어도 그래도 해야지. / 그럼에도 불구하고 희망을 잃지 않았다. / 그렇더라도 예의는 지켜야 한다.
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example_en: It's hard, but still, I have to do it. / Nevertheless, they didn't lose hope. / Even if that's the case, you must maintain courtesy.

뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).korean: 한편 vs 반면(에) vs 이에 반해
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).english:
한편 = meanwhile / on the other hand (transitioning to a different but related topic — mild contrast or addition)
반면(에) = on the other hand / whereas (direct contrast between two sides — balanced comparison)
이에 반해 = in contrast to this (formal — explicitly opposing the preceding statement)
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example: 한편 다른 의견도 있다. / 형은 외향적인 반면 동생은 내성적이다. / 수출은 증가했다. 이에 반해 내수는 감소했다.
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example_en: Meanwhile, there are other opinions. / The older brother is extroverted, whereas the younger is introverted. / Exports increased. In contrast, domestic demand decreased.

뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).english:
~(으)ㄴ 셈이다 = it amounts to / it's as good as (spoken, calculating result — rough equivalence after consideration)
~(으)ㄴ 격이다 = it's tantamount to / it's like (formal — classifying the nature of a situation, slightly literary)
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example: 공짜나 다름없으니 이득인 셈이다. / 그건 약속을 어긴 격이다.
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example_en: Since it's basically free, you could say I came out ahead. / That's tantamount to breaking a promise.

뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).english:
몹시 = terribly / extremely (literary/formal intensifier — often with negative or strong emotions)
되게 = really / super (colloquial, casual — everyday spoken emphasis)
굉장히 = tremendously / incredibly (standard emphasis — versatile, slightly stronger than 매우)
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example: 몹시 추운 겨울이었다. / 되게 맛있다! / 굉장히 인상적인 공연이었다.
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example_en: It was a terribly cold winter. / It's really delicious! / It was a tremendously impressive performance.

뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).english:
~(으)ㄹ 때 = when (standard, everyday temporal clause — any time reference)
~(으)ㄹ 적에 = when / back when (literary/nostalgic — referring to a past time, often childhood or distant memories)
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example: 학교 다닐 때 공부를 열심히 했다. / 어릴 적에 시골에서 놀던 기억이 난다.
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example_en: I studied hard when I was in school. / I remember playing in the countryside back when I was young.

뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).english:
~(으)ㄴ 채(로) = with / while still in the state of (literary, vivid — maintaining a previous condition into a new action)
~(으)ㄴ 상태로 = in the state of / as-is (neutral/formal — describing current condition objectively)
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example: 신발을 신은 채로 들어왔다. / 문이 열린 상태로 방치되어 있었다.
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example_en: Came in with shoes still on. / The door was left in an open state.

뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).english:
~대로 = as / according to (following a standard, instruction, or state — 'as it is', 'as told')
~(에) 따라 = according to / depending on (varying based on conditions — criteria, circumstances, rules)
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example: 시키는 대로 해. / 상황에 따라 다르다.
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example_en: Do as you're told. / It depends on the situation.

뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).english:
~거나 = or (listing alternatives — choosing between options)
~든(지) = whether...or / regardless of which (indifference to the choice — it doesn't matter which)
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example: 커피거나 차를 마시자. / 가든지 말든지 네 마음이야.
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example_en: Let's drink coffee or tea. / Whether you go or not, it's up to you.

뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).english:
더구나 = moreover / what's more (adding a stronger point on top of the previous one — escalation)
하물며 = let alone / much less (formal — if X is the case, then Y is even more so; a fortiori argument)
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example: 피곤한데 더구나 배까지 고프다. / 어른도 힘든데 하물며 아이는 오죽하겠어.
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example_en: I'm tired, and what's more, I'm hungry too. / Even adults find it hard, let alone a child.

뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).english:
차마 = can't bring oneself to (emotional inability — too painful, cruel, or heartless to do; always with negative)
감히 = dare to (audacity or presumption — doing something beyond one's station; with negative: 'wouldn't dare')
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example: 차마 그 말을 할 수 없었다. / 감히 어른 앞에서 그런 행동을 하다니.
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example_en: I couldn't bring myself to say those words. / How dare you behave like that in front of an elder.
